channel.title: American Thinker
channel.feedburner:browserFriendly: This is an XML content feed. It is intended to be viewed in a newsreader or syndicated to another site, subject to copyright and fair use.

item.title: The GOP Outreach that Dare Not Speak Its Name
item.description: An ethnic group that is now taboo

item.title: Colorado Democrats to Rape Victims: Lie Back and Enjoy It
item.description: What Barack Obama called a "national conversation" about guns has turned into an all-out war on the Second Amendment.

item.title: Gay Marriage and Legal Surrealism
item.description: There is something slightly absurd about a small panel of jurists sitting in judgment on thousands of years of history, experience, and (for those who believe) divine revelation.

item.title: Candidate Promises Statue of Free Cheese in Norman, OK
item.description: Paid for out of the generous public funding of the Norman Arts Council who are currently spending taxpayers' money anyway, but on much less meaningful projects.

item.title: The Supreme Court and Faux-marriage Fallacies
item.description: The Supreme Court is behaving as a reluctant agent of social engineering and not an ardent guardian of constitutional integrity in its approach to the last two days of oral argument on marriage.

item.title: The GOP's $10M Could Fund Long-Suffering Under-Funded Black Conservative Outreaches
item.description: If the GOP's going to spend millions on "minority outreach," why not actually do it right?

item.title: Europe acquiesces while Jews are threatened, and killed. Again
item.description: The Jews of Europe need to wake up to reality. There is no future for Jewish life in that dark continent.

item.title: Freaking the Straights on Gay Marriage
item.description: An attempt by the smallest of tails to wag the largest of dogs. The gay movement demands not tolerance, not the friction-filled tumult of American life that everyone else is subject to, but full acceptance of themselves and their lifestyle

item.title: Is the Republican Party America's Achilles Heel?
item.description: The inability of the Republican Establishment to understand that the American Left, who are now in control of the Democratic Party, are the implacable enemy in a battle for the heart and soul of America.

item.title: Baby Sea Lion Murder at Laguna Beach
item.description: Does the dog come with a pistol grip?

item.title: The Threat of Islamic Betrayal
item.description: Recent incidents in Turkey -- certainly the most "moderate" of Islamic states -- underlines the untrustworthy nature of Islamic supremacist ideology.

item.title: If I Were a Governor....
item.description: The path toward reform will not be easy -- but nothing worthwhile is ever easy.

item.title: Refining Our 'Theory' of Taxation
item.description: We Americans are taxed at just about every juncture in life that involves money. Is that the way the Founders wanted it?

item.title: The Manufactured Authority of the Nanny State
item.description: Leftist social engineers have never been so brazen as they have recently in suggesting that we are helpless without government.

item.title: John Brennan's Spooky Swearing-In
item.description: The reasons behind John Brennan's constituional swearing-in stunt remain mysterious.

item.title: State of Illinois, meet Reality
item.description: How Obama learned that insane government spending was the road to utopia -- the short course.

item.title: We Can Do Better Than This
item.description: If conservatives want political power we are going to have to find a new enemy for the American people to fight. Why not the liberal ruling class?

item.title: Ich bin ein Israeli
item.description: It behooves every freedom-loving individual to remember the legacy of master terrorist Yasser Arafat -- and why Barack Obama should not have had a single word to say under Arafat's picture.

item.title: What Science Really Says about Religion
item.description: Science itself emphatically does not disprove religion; the notion that they're in conflict belongs to professors in the humanities who passed only a minimum science requirement decades ago.

item.title: LGBTs Can Thrive By Building Courageous Bridges
item.description: In 2013, there is no ban on homosexual civil rights. What is at issue is whether the government will recognize polygamy/polyamory relationships and varied households as marriage and then force every citizen and business to do so as well.

item.title: The European Union Must Act on Hezb'allah
item.description: The idea that the EU doesn't have sufficient evidence to designate Hezb'allah a terrorist nation is ridiculous -- yet that's exactly what the EU Council is saying.

item.title: The Dream of a World Without Oil
item.description: 3,800,000 wind turbines? This one sounds more like a nightmare.

item.title: Obama's Tyranny: Petty or Something More Sinister?
item.description: the Administration is holding a gun to the head of almost every single American in its quest to inflict the maximum pain possible on each of us to achieve its political objectives. When has this occurred in our country's history?

item.title: In Defense of Racial Humor
item.description: If laughter really is the best medicine, it's no wonder race relations are in a state of ill health.

item.title: Barack Obama's Excellent Israeli Adventure
item.description: With a kippah on his head and a truckful of platitudes in tow.
